title: Trust in God’s Justice
shortSummary: Psalm 11 is a confident declaration of trust in the Lord amid threats from the wicked. David expresses faith that God, who reigns in heaven, observes all and will bring righteous judgment against evildoers while protecting the upright.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The psalmist and king of Israel who expresses his trust in God’s protection and justice in the face of wicked opposition.

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked
keyCharacters.description: Those who oppose the righteous, preparing to harm the upright secretly and violently.

definitions.definition: The leader or director of music in the temple, responsible for overseeing the singing and instrumental accompaniment.
Those who live with integrity and righteousness, sincere in their devotion to God.
Symbolic of the basic principles or stability of society or faith; their destruction implies chaos and moral collapse.
To test or examine closely, often referring to God’s examination of human hearts and motives.

outline.heading: Confidence Amid Danger
outline.description: David declares his trust in the Lord despite advice to flee from danger, questioning what the righteous can do if the very foundations of justice and order are destroyed.

outline.heading: God’s Sovereign Observation
outline.description: The psalmist affirms that God is enthroned in heaven, watching all people and testing the righteous while hating the wicked and those who love violence.

outline.heading: Judgment and Protection
outline.description: God will bring severe judgment upon the wicked, but His favor and protection rest upon the righteous because He loves righteousness and looks upon the upright.

application: Place your full trust in God even when circumstances suggest fleeing or fear; He is sovereign over all.
Remember that God sees and tests the heart; live with integrity and righteousness before Him.
Take comfort that God will judge wickedness and protect those who live uprightly.
Commit to loving righteousness and rejecting violence, reflecting God’s character in your own life.

keyVerses.text: In the LORD put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the psalmist’s unwavering trust in God despite counsel to escape danger.

keyVerses.text: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD'S throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes God’s sovereign oversight and His active examination of human hearts.

keyVerses.text: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms God’s love for righteousness and His favor toward those who live uprightly.
